snippet: Europe’s largest financial institutions, including HSBC and Deutsche Bank, are expected to sell a combined $78 billion of so-called noncore loans this year, a 33 percent rise compared with 2012, estimates from PricewaterhouseCoopers show.
abstract: Europe’s largest financial institutions, including HSBC and Deutsche Bank, are expected to sell a combined $78 billion of so-called noncore loans this year, a 33 percent rise compared with 2012, estimates from PricewaterhouseCoopers show.

headline.main: More European Bank Loan Sales Expected
headline.print_headline: Top European Banks Expected To Sell Assets
